narrative.title: 5 Leichte Division - 1941Q2
narrative.situation: German Light Motorized Division deployed in North Africa during 1941Q2.
narrative.objectives: Light motorized division for mobile operations in North Africa. Lighter than standard panzer division but more mobile and suitable for desert warfare with extended supply lines. Primary roles: Tobruk siege operations, mobile defense, rapid counterattacks, exploitation.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal desert (Cyrenaica) - sand, gravel, escarpments, limited water. Tobruk perimeter operations.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mobile desert warfare with reduced logistical footprint vs. panzer division
Combined arms coordination (tanks, motorized MG battalions, AT guns, artillery)
Rapid redeployment capability on interior lines
Self-propelled AT and AA battalions for mobile operations
Extensive reconnaissance capability (Aufkl√§rungs-Abteilung 3, armored cars, motorcycles)
88mm FlaK dual-role (AA and devastating AT) - Rommel's 'secret weapon'

environment.terrain_type: Coastal desert (Cyrenaica) - sand, gravel, escarpments, limited water. Tobruk perimeter operations.
